title: Elderly man still in hospital with life threatening injuries after crash
text:
0 comments 
AN ELDERLY man continues to fight for his life today after a horrific three-vehicle crash on the A35 near Lyndhurst . 
As previously reported by the Daily Echo , the 81-year-old is battling life-threatening chest injuries in hospital this morning after a collision between the A337 Shrubbs Hill Road and Rhinefield Ornamental Drive at 7.19pm on Wednesday. 
Emergency services rushed to the stretch of highway and a South Central Ambulance spokesperson confirmed three ambulance crews, a doctor and a rapid response unit were deployed to the scene after reports of four casualties. 
The elderly man was a passenger in a Honda Jazz and was taken to Southampton General Hospital, where he remains. 
The driver, a 76-year-old woman, was also taken to Southampton General Hospital , with minor injuries, as well as a second woman, in her 30s. 
A fourth male casualty was assessed by paramedics at the scene but did not require hospital treatment. 
A spokesperson for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service said crews from Burley and Brockenhurst released two casualties trapped inside the vehicles - a Honda Jazz, a Honda Civic and a Ford Galaxy - a process completed just before 8pm. Share article 
The road was closed in both directions.
